org.araneaframework.uilib.form.constraint
Class ReverseConstraint

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.uilib.form.constraint.BaseConstraint
      org.araneaframework.uilib.form.constraint.ReverseConstraint
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Constraint
public class ReverseConstraint
extends BaseConstraint

A Constraint that reverses the effect of the contained Constraint — validating this constraint only when the contained Constraint is invalid. When contained Constraint is valid, an error message (set with Constraint.setCustomErrorMessage(String)) is produced.

Since:
1.1
Author:
Taimo Peelo (taimo@araneaframework.org)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
static interface ReverseConstraint.ReverseConstraintErrorMessageFactory
          Can be used to produce reverse constraint validation error message, where ReverseConstraint(Constraint, String) or BaseConstraint.setCustomErrorMessage(String) do not suffice.

Constructor Detail

ReverseConstraint

public ReverseConstraint(Constraint toReverse)
Creates a new reverse constraint with given contained constraint. If the latter validates, the reverse constraint does not, and vice versa.

Parameters:
toReverse - The constraint to reverse.

ReverseConstraint

public ReverseConstraint(Constraint toReverse,
                         String customErrorMessage)
Creates a new reverse constraint with given contained constraint and an error message. If the given constraint validates, this reverse constraint does not, and vice versa.

Parameters:
toReverse - The constraint to reverse.
customErrorMessage - The error message to produce when the contained constraint validates.

ReverseConstraint

public ReverseConstraint(Constraint toReverse,
                         ReverseConstraint.ReverseConstraintErrorMessageFactory errorMessageFactory)
Creates a new reverse constraint with given contained constraint and error message factory. If the constraint validates, then this reverse constraint does not, and vice versa.

The errorMessageFactory is factory implementation that should be able to provide a custom error message for this reverse constraint.

Parameters:
toReverse - The constraint to reverse.
errorMessageFactory - A custom factory that returns appropriate error messages.
Method Detail

getConstraint

public Constraint getConstraint()
Provides access to the contained constrained.

Returns:
The Constraint reversed by this ReverseConstraint.

validateConstraint

protected void validateConstraint()
                           throws Exception
It has the opposite effect on the contained constraint. If the latter validates, this method does not, and vice versa.

Specified by:
validateConstraint in class BaseConstraint
Throws:
Exception - Any runtime exception that may occur.

setEnvironment

public void setEnvironment(Environment environment)
Description copied from interface: Constraint
Sets the Environment of this Constraint. Environment should come from whatever Component that this Constraint is operating on.

The Environment of a Constraint may be set to non-null value only once, further calls are ignored. Application programmer typically never calls this method as Environment is propagated seamlessly.

Specified by:
setEnvironment in interface Constraint
Overrides:
setEnvironment in class BaseConstraint
Parameters:
environment - The Environment for this constraint to use.
